item.title: Roman Emperors
item.description: Introduction For my first TidyTuesday post I decided to explore the Roman Emperors data set from 26 BCE to 395 CE. What’s interesting is that even in an authoritarian form of government such as the Roman Empire, democratically elected emperors had longer reigns than those who rose to power by other means. The shortest reign was that of Didius Julianus, the only emperor who purchased the throne outright. Julianus offered to pay the Praetorian Guard 25,000 sesterces for every soldier (41x a soldier’s annual salary) in exchange for the throne.
